sect2.title: company, sme:pluralName=companies, sme:compliance=MUST, sme:canGet=TRUE , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Company is an ‘active’ Company .
Flag to indicate if Company is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the Customer (if any) associated with this Company.
Flag to indicate that Company and Customer are the same – properties that are the same on both resources should come from the Customer if this is set to True.
If “Use Customer Data” is set to True then “Use Supplier Data” MUST be False.
Link to the Supplier (if any) associated with this Company.
Flag to indicate that Company and Supplier are the same– properties that are the same on both resources should come from the Supplier if this is set to True.
“Use Supplier Data” can only be set to True when “Use Customer Data” is False.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Company.
A shorter name for the Company.
The Company currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
Link to the Contact(s) associated with the Company
Identifier(s) of the Company as used by the third parties (e.g. Company Registration Number, DUNS number, 1099 type, CIS number, siret number, Trading Number, etc).
The tax-locale applicable to the Operating Company (e.g. District)
Tax reference associated with the Company (e.g. VAT number, numero intracommnunautaire, FEIN)
Bank account associated with the Company e.g. for electronic Payment, direct debits, bank transfers, etc.
The industry code of the Company.
Language used by the Company (e.g. EN-GB)
Link to child Company associated with this Company.
Companies can be ‘nested’ to create organizational hierarchies.
Link to child Company associated with this Company.
Companies can be ‘nested’ to create organizational hierarchies.
Sales Quotation(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Order(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Order Delivery(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Invoice(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Return(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Return Delivery(s) associated with the Company.
Sales Credit(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Requisition(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Order(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Order Delivery(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Invoice(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Return(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Return Delivery(s) associated with the Company.
Purchase Credit(s) associated with the Company.

sect2.title: customer, sme:pluralName=customers, sme:compliance=MUST , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Customer is an ‘active’ Customer .
Flag to indicate if the Customer is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the Company associated with the Customer.
Link to the trading account associated with this Customer.
A Customer can have multiple trading accounts to support e.g. different currencies.
Flag to indicate that Customer and Trading Account are the same – properties that are the same on both resources should come from the Trading Account if this is set to True.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Customer.
The reference for the Customer as defined by the Customer themselves (e.g. an open PO number).
The Customer name. This may be different to the Company name (e.g. to handle T/A – Trading As – scenario).
A shorter name for the Customer.
The Customer type (e.g. Retail, Wholesale, etc).
Link to any Customer Group(s) this Customer belongs to.
Link to the main Customer address(es)
Link to the main Customer shipping address.
Link to the main Customer billing address.
Link to the Contact(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales person(s) associated with the Customer.
Also known as Sales Agent or Manager in some applications.
There may be multiple and commission may be spread across multiple sales people.
Preferred Delivery method to be used for the Customer (e.g. Courier, Collection ,etc)
Does the Customer accept full or partial deliveries.
False = Does not accept partial deliveries.
Link to the Contact for buying at this Customer.
The default Location to be used for fulfillment (e.g. the warehouse to take deliveries of purchase orders or from which to deliver sales orders).
Bank account associated with the Customer e.g. for electronic Payment, direct debits, bank transfers, etc.
Default ‘Seller’ (system user) associated with this Customer e.g. the sales clerk.
The ‘user’ resource will be defined in the future.
Sales Quotation(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Order(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Order Delivery(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Invoice(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Return(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Return Delivery(s) associated with the Customer.
Sales Credit(s) associated with the Customer.

sect2.title: supplier, sme:pluralName=suppliers, sme:compliance=SHOULD , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Supplier is an ‘active’ Supplier.
Flag to indicate if the Supplier is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the Company associated with the Supplier.
Link to the trading account associated with this Supplier.
A Supplier can have multiple trading accounts to support e.g. different currencies.
Flag to indicate that Supplier and Trading Account are the same – properties that are the same on both resources should come from the Trading Account if this is set to True.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Supplier.
The reference for the Supplier as defined by the Supplier themselves (e.g. “Please quote ABCXYZ on all orders….”).
The Supplier name. This may be different to the Company name (e.g. to handle T/A – Trading As – scenario).
A shorter name for the Supplier.
The Supplier type (e.g. Retail, Wholesale, etc).
Link to any Supplier Group(s) this Supplier belongs to.
Link to the main Supplier address(es)
Link to the Contact(s) associated with the Supplier.
The default Location to be used for fulfillment (e.g. the warehouse to take deliveries of purchase orders or from which to deliver sales orders).
Bank account associated with the Supplier e.g. for electronic Payment, direct debits, bank transfers, etc.
Purchase Requsition(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Order(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Order Delivery(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Invoice(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Return(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Return Delivery(s) associated with the Supplier.
Purchase Credit(s) associated with the Supplier.

sect2.title: tradingAccount, sme:pluralName=tradingAccounts, sme:compliance=MUST , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Trading Account is an ‘active’ account .
Flag to indicate if Trading Account is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
A flag to indicate if the Trading Account is a Customer or Supplier.
This can be derived from the entity linked to this Trading Account (either “Customer” or “Supplier”).
A link to the Customer associated with this Trading Account (if Customer Supplier Flag = “Customer”).
A link to the Supplier associated with this Trading Account (if Customer Supplier Flag = “Supplier”).
Link to the Trading Account to be invoiced for transactions (e.g Sales Orders, Purchase Orders) if different from this TradingAccount.
Date the Trading Account was opened.
Additional reference for the Trading Account.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Trading Account.
A shorter name for the Trading Account.
Link to the Trading Account address(es) (e.g. Invoice/billing address).
Link to the Trading Account shipping address.
Link to the Trading Account billing address.
Link to the accounting Contact(s) for this Customer.
Link to the Contact for deliveries to this Trading Account.
Sales person(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Also known as Sales Agent or Manager in some applications.
There may be multiple and commission may be spread across multiple sales people.
Preferred Delivery method to be used for the Trading Account (e.g. Courier, Collection ,etc)
Does the Trading Account accept full or partial deliveries.
False = Does not accept partial deliveries.
The Trading Account currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
Tax code governing the tax regime applicable to this Trading Account.
Tax reference associated with the Trading Account.
The country whose tax regime applies to this Trading Account.
Flag to indicate if prices associated with this Trading Account are inclusive of tax, or not.
Default = No (prices are not inclusive of tax)
The date upon which the finance balance was based.
Trading account financial status (e.g. on hold (or “blocked”), off hold).
True is on hold, False is not on hold.
Trading account financial status text. Please note: this is the label used to describe the Finance Status Flag above – it is not a status in its own right.
Flag to indicate the type of settlement discount applicable to the Trading Account (percent or amount)
Settlement discount applicable to the Trading Account expressed as an amount.
Settlement discount applicable to the Trading Account expressed as a percent.
Terms applicable to the settlement discount, often expressed as a number of days.
For some types of settlement discount it is necessary to know when the terms start, e.g. if terms are 30 days from end of month.
TradingAccount Settlement Discount Included In Total
Flag to indicate if settlement discount is included in document totals (e.g. Invoices, etc).
Period in which outstanding amounts must be paid (e.g. 30 days, by end of month “EOM”). Also after this period additional (sur)charges may apply.
For some types of payment terms it is necessary to know when the terms start, e.g. if terms are 30 days from end of month.
Flag to indicate the type of order discount applicable to the Trading Account (percent or amount)
Any discount that may be applicable to orders (or quotations) raised against the account, expressed as an amount.
Any discount that may be applicable to orders (or quotations) raised against the account, expressed as a percent.
Text to be shown by default on orders raised against this Trading Account.
Text to be shown by default on orders raised against this Trading Account.
Flag to indicate the type of order Line discount applicable to the Trading Account (percent or amount)
Any discount that may be applicable to order (or quotation) lines raised against the account, expressed as an amount.
Any discount that may be applicable to order (or quotation) lines raised against the account, expressed as a percent.
Text to be shown by default on order lines raised against this Trading Account.
Text to be shown by default on order lines raised against this Trading Account.
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to invoices raised against the Trading Account (percent or amount)
Any discount that may be applicable to invoices raised against the Trading Account, expressed as an amount.
Any discount that may be applicable to invoices raised against the Trading Account, expressed as a percentage.
Text to be shown by default on Invoice raised against this Trading Account.
Text to be shown by default on Invoice raised against this Trading Account.
Bank account associated with the Trading Account e.g. for electronic Payment, direct debits, bank transfers, etc.

Tender Type used by Trading Account (e.g. if this Trading Account is associated with a Customer then this is the tender type used on Receipts/Payments associated with the Customer, e.g. BACS, check, Cash, Commercial Papers, etc).
The default Location to be used for fulfillment (e.g. the warehouse to take deliveries of purchase orders or from which to deliver sales orders).
Price list associated with the Trading Account.
Pricing override applicable with the Trading Account (e.g. for discounting).
Accounting type applicable to the Trading Account (e.g. cash, open item, balance forward, etc).
Financial accounting code applicable to the Trading Account (typically the revenue account).
Flag to indicate if this is the primary Trading Account associated with a Customer (or Supplier).
Only 1 Trading Account can be the primary for an associated Customer (or Supplier).
Opportunities associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Quotation(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Order(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Order Delivery(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Invoice(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Return(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Return Delivery(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Sales Credit(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Requisition(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Order(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Order Delivery(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Invoice(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Return(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Return Delivery(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Purchase Credit(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Receipt(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Payment(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Interaction(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Case(s) associated with the Trading Account.
Notes associated with a Trading Account (e.g. credit control).

sect2.title: contact, sme:pluralName=contacts, sme:compliance=MUST , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: A link to the Contact Group associated with this Contact.
Contacts can belong to multiple Contact Groups.
Flag to indicate if the Contact is an ‘active’ Contact .
Flag to indicate if Contact is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Contact.
The gender of the Contact (e.g. Male, Female, Not Specified).
The full name of the Contact e.g title, first name, family name, suitably spaced.
The salutation to be used when addressing the Contact (“Dear”, “Your Excellency”, etc).
The first name of the Contact.
The name preferred by the Contact – may be first name or a nick name.
Could use First Name as default
The family name (surname) of the Contact.
The middle name of the Contact.
A name suffix associated with the .Contact (e.g. PhD, OBE, etc)
Financial accounting code applicable to the Contact (typically the revenue account).
Could be calculated from date of birth.
The date of birth of the Contact.
Language used (spoken) by the Contact (e.g. EN-GB).
The marital status (single, married, etc) of the Contact.
The country of residence of the Contact.
The national insurance, or country-specific equivalent, number.
reference number for tax purposes of the Contact (e.g. UK UTR).
Link to the Contact address(es) (e.g. office, home).
Link to the Company associated with the Contact.
Link to the Customer (if any) associated with this Contact.
Link to the Supplier (if any) associated with this Contact.
Link to the Trading Account (if any) associated with this Contact.
Link to the Bank Account (if any) associated with this Contact.
Link to the Location (if any) associated with this Contact.
The job title of the Contact.
The description of the Contact’s reference with a Company (if any) e.g. Employee, Subcontractor, etc.
Default system user associated with this Contact e.g. the Contact manager.
The ‘user’ resource will be defined in the future.
A link to the Employee associated with this Contact.
See “Employee” definition. Employee’s are defined in the HRM-ERP Schema.
A flag to indicate if the Contact is the primary/default Contact.
Only one Contact can have primacy against an associated Company.
Sales Quotation(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Order(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Order Delivery(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Invoice(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Return(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Return Delivery(s) associated with the Contact.
Sales Credit(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Requisition(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Order(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Order Delivery(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Invoice(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Return(s) associated with the Contact.
Purchase Return Delivery(s) associated with the Contact.

sect2.title: contactGroup, sme:pluralName=contactGroups, sme:compliance=MAY , sme:canPut=FALSE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=FALSE, sme:canDelete=FALSE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Contact Group is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Contact Group is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
If this does not exist then a dummy entry should be created, e.g. “MAS500 Customer Contacts”
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Contact Group.
A longer description of the Contact Group.
A link to other Contact Group(s) associated with this one.
Contacts associated with the Contact Group.
Contacts can belong to multiple Contact Groups.
Notes associated with a Contact Group.

sect2.title: postalAddress, sme:pluralName=postalAddresses, sme:compliance=MUST , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Postal Address is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Postal Address is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
A name for the Postal Address (e.g. “Billing Address”).
A longer description of the postal Postal Address.
For USA addresses use ISO 3166-2:US for state codes.
A flag to indicate if the Address is the primary/default Address.
One ony Postal Address can have Primacy against an associated entity (e.g. Contact, Company, etc).
The type of the Postal Address, e.g., billing, sales address, home, etc.
A new Postal Address will be required for each type, even though the address itself may be the same.
Notes associated with the Postal Address.

sect2.title: salesOrder, sme:pluralName=salesOrders, sme:compliance=SHOULD , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=FALSE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Sales Order is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Sales Order is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Additional reference for the Sales Order.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Sales Order.
Status of Commodity allocations against the order.
Additional Boolean status flag (e.g. order on hold (or “blocked”), off hold).
True is on hold, False is not on hold.
Company associated with the Sales Order
Customer associated with the Sales Order.
Link to the Sales Order Customer account.
Customer own reference for the Sales Order (e.g. a PO number).
Opportunity linked to the Sales Order (if any).
Link to the Price List used when generating the Sales Order
Link to the Sales Order Supplier account (e.g. for back to back, contremarque, drop-ship ordering).
These are also stored on SalesOrderLines
Supplier own reference for the Sales Order.
Link to any Supplier Purchase Orders used to fulfill the Sales Order (back to back or drop-ship).
These are also stored on SalesOrderLines
Indicates if this Sales Order is a copy or not.
reference to another Sales Order if required (e.g. if order is a copy, then this will show which order was copied, If this is a replacement order this will show the original order).
A link to the quotation used to create this Sales Order (if any).
Link to Postal Address(es) associated with the Sales Order.
Could be multiple e.g. shipping, billing, etc
These are also stored on SalesOrderLines
Delivery method to be employed for Sales Order (e.g. Courier, Collection ,etc)
Flag to indicate if the order has to be delivered in full or can be split across partial deliveries.
The anticipated date of the Delivery.
Date the order is due by the Customer.
Delivery date may be different to the Customer due date.
Link to the Company that will be the carrier / freight forwarder/ deliverer of the Sales Order
Carriers are not used by all application.
Link to the Supplier associated with the Company that wll be the carrier / freight forwarder / deliverer of the Sales Order.
Carriers are not used by all application.
Link to the Trading Account associated with the Supplier that wll be the carrier / freight forwarder / deliverer of the Sales Order.
Carriers are not used by all application.
The total price of Delivery/carriage (net + tax).
A link to the Sales Invoice generated to recharge the carriage to the Customer.
A link to the purchase Invoice charged by the carrier Company for the Delivery to the Customer.
Tax code governing the tax regime applicable to the carriage on this Sales Order.
reference number as used by the carrier during Delivery e.g. for Delivery tracking.
The currency of the Sales Order (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Sales Order Currency into Sales Order OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
SalesOrder OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Sales Order Currency to Sales Order OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
SalesOrder OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Sales Order Currency to Sales Order OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
The currency to be used on invoices associated with this order.
Could be derived from order currency.
Rate used to convert from Sales Order Currency into Sales Order Invoice Currency, if different.
SalesOrder Invoice Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Sales Order Currency to Sales Order Invoice Currency
E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Invoice Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order Invoice Currency.
SalesOrder Invoice Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Sales Order Currency to Sales Order Invoice Currency, if different.
The currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR) used by the Customer Trading Account on the Sales Order.
Could be derived from order currency.
SalesOrder Customer TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate
Rate used to convert the Sales Order currency into the Customer Trading Account currency, if different.
SalesOrder Customer TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Sales Order Currency to Sales Order Customer Trading Account Currency

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Customer TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order Customer TradingAccount Currency.
SalesOrder Customer TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Sales Order Currency to Customer Trading Account Currency, if different.
Date the Sales Order was placed.
Time the Sales Order was placed.
Period the Sales Order is valid for (days from Order Date).
The expiration date of the Sales Order (SalesOrder Date + Validity).
Tax code governing the tax regime applicable to this Sales Order.
Link to the Contact at Customer who placed the Sales Order.
Sales person associated with the Sales Order.
Also known as Sales Agent or Manager in some applications.
There may be multiple and commission may be spread across multiple sales people.
Link to the user who placed the Sales Order.
The ‘user’ resource will be defined in the future.
Sales order Line detail (e.g. items on the Sales Order)
The number of lines on the Sales Order.
Should be auto-populated. Used as a cross reference to ensure order integrity.
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to this Sales Order (percent or amount)
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as an amount.
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as a percent.
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to this Sales Order (percent or amount)
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as an amount.
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as a percent.
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to this Sales Order (percent or amount)
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as an amount.
Discount applicable to the Sales Order expressed as a percent.
Text/commentary (e.g. special Delivery instructions) for the Sales Order
Further text/commentary for the Sales Order.
Total value of the Sales Order, including discounts, excluding tax.
Total discounts applied to the order
Total value of any (sur)charges applied to the Sales Order (e.g. finance charges, interest).
Total tax applicable to the Sales Order.
Total value of the Sales Order, including tax & discounts & charges.
Total cost of the Sales Order.
Total profit on the Sales Order (e.g. net total – cost total).
Link to the Sales Order receipt (e.g. if order is taken with payment or if a deposit has been paid).
Flag to indicate if a deposit has been paid with the order.
reference to a contract associated with the Sales Order. If Contracts aren’t used there may be an estimate instead – this would contain the reference of the estimate.
Link to the Trading Account to be invoiced for the Sales Order (if different from the Customer) e.g. Bill To
Country to which the Sales Invoice is sent (e.g. for taxation purposes).
Country of destination for the Sales Order (e.g. for customs purposes).
Identifier of the Project this Sales Order is for.
Project Line value for this Sales Order.
Some applications may not have Project Lines.
The reference of the ‘case’ associated with the Sales Order e.g. if the Order is for repair/fix services.
A ‘Case’ entity hase been defined to support the F2F process.
Link to the Delivery (dispatch) against the Sales Order. If there are multiple then these are held against the Sales Order Line.
The Location from which the Sales Order will be fulfilled (e.g. the warehouse holding the Commodity).
May be held at Line level instead.
Financial accounting code applicable to the Sales Order.
Could come from the Trading Account.
Interaction(s) associated with the Sales Order.
Notes associated with a Sales Order.

sect2.title: salesOrderLine, sme:pluralName=salesOrderLines, sme:compliance=SHOULD , sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=FALSE

entry.para: The Sales Order this Line belongs to.
The Sales Order Line unique identifier.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Flag to indicate if the Sales Order Line is an ‘active’ one .

reference for the Sales Order Line.

The number of the Sales Order Line.
For sequencing and ordering of lines.

Commentary (without price, e.g. “thank you for your business!”);
Component (with price but not in total);
The terms for Delivery for this Sales Order Line.
Also on Sales Order but may be different per Line.
Link to the Commodity used on the Sales Order Line.
Not mandatory as Line may be a free text or comment Line.

The Variant of the Commodity (e.g. colour or size) on the Sales Order Line.
The Dimension of the Commodity on the Sales Order Line.
Link to the Commodity associated with the Sales Order Line, e.g. if Line is for service to another Commodity.
The Location from which the Sales Order Line will be fulfilled (e.g. the warehouse holding the Commodity).

Carriers are not used by all application.

reference number as used by the carrier during Delivery e.g. for Delivery tracking.

Link to any Supplier Purchase Order Lines used to fulfill the Sales Order Line (back to back or drop-ship).
A link to the Quotation Line used to create this Sales Order Line (if any).
Link to Postal Address(es) associated with the Sales Order Line (ship to).
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to this Sales Order Line (percent or amount)
Discount applicable to the Sales Order Line, expressed as an amount.
Discount applicable to the Sales Order Line, expressed as a percentage.
SalesOrderLine Order Line Subtotal Discount Type
Flag to indicate the type of discount applicable to a subtotal of Sales Order lines (percent or amount) of which this Line is part.
SalesOrderLine Order Line Subtotal Discount Amount
Discount applicable to the Sales Order Line, expressed as an amount.
SalesOrderLine Order Line Subtotal Discount Percent
Discount applicable to the Sales Order Line, expressed as a percentage.

The FOB point applicable to the Sales Order Line. FOB is an abbreviation for Free On Board. The term FOB is used when shipping goods, to indicate who pays loading and transportation costs, and/or the point at which the responsibility of the goods transfers from shipper to buyer
The actual price of the Commodity ordered on the Sales Order Line (e.g. after discounts or adjustments).
Total value of the Sales Order Line, including discounts and charges, excluding tax (e.g. quantity * actual price)
Total value of any (sur)charges applied to the Sales Order Line (e.g. finance charges, interest).
Total discounts applied to the order line
Tax code governing the tax regime applicable to this Sales Order Line (default value from Sales Order).
Tax applicable to the Sales Order Line price e.g. the per unit tax.
Both unit-tax and Line-tax values are required due to the way tax is handled differently by product/country.
Tax applicable to the Sales Order Line.
Both unit-tax and Line-tax values are required due to the way tax is handled differently by product/country.
Total value of the Sales Order Line, including discounts & tax & charges.
Total cost of the Sales Order Line.
Total profit on the Sales Order Line (e.g. net total – cost total).
Sales Invoice Line(s) associated with the Sales Order Line.

reference associated with the phone number.
Another reference associated with the phone number.
A phone unique reference number used to represent the number in a formal way. Useful for programmatic access, such as a VoIP/PSTN/CTI.
Could be derived by concatenating attributes.
A value that identifies the type of phone number (general, fax, car, home, internal, mobile, other, pager, satellite, voip, work).

A simple string value used to label this phone number. In most cases, “Label” is not necessary as “Phone Type” uniquely identifies a number and allows UIs to display a proper label such as "Mobile", "Home", "Work", etc. However, in the case where one person has (for example) multiple mobile phones, this property can be used to disambiguate them.
Could be derived from Phone Type
Human-readable phone number, containing all attributes.
Could be derived by concatenating other properties.
Country code for the phone number based on ITU-T recommendation E.164 country codes.
Area code for the phone number
Any extension applicable to the phone number.
Flag to indicate if this Phone Number is the primary one associated with the linked resource.

Company the Case is for, if any.

Rate used to convert from Case Currency into Case OperatingCompany Currency, if different.

Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Case Currency to Case OperatingCompany Currency.
E.g. if the operator is division then it is Case Values in Case Currency / Case Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Case Values in Case OperatingCompany currency.
Case OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Case Currency to Case OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
A link to the sales order(s) generated for this case, if any.
A link to the sales order Delivery(s) generated for this case, if any.
A link to the Sales Invoice(s) generated for this case, if any.
Current Revenue balance on the Case.
Date the last revenue transaction was posted to the Case (e.g. date of the Revenue Balance).

A link to the Purchase Invoice(s) generated for this case, if any.

Link to the Commodity associated with the Case, if any.
Link to the Commodity Identifier(s) for this Case, if it is traced to that level of detail.

Additional attribute to support Case workflow. This attribute can be used to track e.g. the stage in the case cycle.
reference to a contract associated with the Case.
Flag to indicate if the Case is private or public. Private typically means it is not available for Customer (or Supplier) self service applications.
